questions.question: 1. Time complexity of searching in a binary search tree is

explanations.c: All operations are order height, so they are all O(n) since the tree can be highly unbalanced.

questions.question: 2. Time complexity of deleting from a binary search tree is

explanations.c: All operations are order height, so they are all O(n) since the tree can be highly unbalanced.

questions.question: 3. Time complexity of deleting from a balanced binary search tree is

explanations.d: All operations are order height, so they are all O(log n) since the tree is given to be balanced.

questions.question: 4. If all the queries in a BST come after all the insertions and deletions, then which of the following algorithms is faster than a BST at the same task:

explanations.b: The static version of binary search tree is just binary search.
